channel.title: Yongsan-gu on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: 5 Best Desserts Found in Itaewon Alley - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
'Frank''s Rainbow Cake

5 Best Desserts Found in Itaewon Alley

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

Dessert, is there something sweeter and more tempting than this? A bitter black coffee and a dessert that was born in a natural way began to make a refreshing transformation with a beer and a meal instead of a meal. The five desserts I found on Itaewon's alleys are as delicious and lovely as the exotic. The power of a piece of dessert that blows away everyday stress in one room! Whispers secretly and sweetly despite the high calories and burdensome prices. It's okay, it's a dessert.

When did we start eating sweet desserts after meals? In the era when a piece of cake was the best dessert, the dessert craze was popping out with a refreshing idea. The scent of baking cakes and pies in the alley of Itaewon, the center of desserts that can be called a light culture or a sweet luxury.
Green Tea Crepe Cake by Lady M
From crispy street churros to eat on the streets to Tartin's authentic American pies, over 20 homemade pies, Frank's rainbow roll cake full of splashy desserts, and Turkish desserts. Dessert Kervan Bakery's Dessert Let's meet the five best desserts, moist and sweet, including Baklava, and Lady M's wheat crepe cake, loved by New Yorkers.
'Tartin' Chocolate Cream Pie
Authentic homemade pie made from mom's recipe, tartin
Tartin, which started as a small dessert shop in the alley of Itaewon in 2008, sold 20,000 homemade pies until September this year. If you go to a tartin that makes authentic American pies, you can taste the pies, cookies, and cakes with sincerity like mom's pies.
Outdoor table between 1st and 2nd tartin
Insist on the same 100% handmade recipes made by the mother of Tartin's chef Edward. The price is high by making homemade ingredients as well as caramel sauce that goes into the pie, but the taste of the pie is fresh with seasonal fruits.
Make about 20 kinds of pies with fresh seasonal fruits and nuts
In the fall, you can meet about 10 different pies, including sweet and sour wild berry pie mixed with blackberry, blueberry, and strawberry, buttery tart, a savory Canadian pie, and paradise spicy, which combines the rich flavor of walnut and coconut. have. Pecan pie with whole walnuts is popular as a weekend brunch due to its rich and rich taste.
A la mode with ice cream on pecan pie
Lady M, a crepe cake created by the craftsmanship

When you go to Lady M, which opened in August of this year, you can meet three different types of crepe cakes made by stacking 20 layers of crepes. There are three types of cake: chocolate crepe, vanilla wheat crepe, and green tea crepe. Its taste is as soft and rich as a fresh cream that is soaked between 20 or more crepes.

White veil in a neat white building

In addition to aging the basic ingredients for a day, crepe cakes that come out every morning insist on daily production sales because they have to go through tricky processes such as making cakes and refrigerating them for 12 hours. The crepe cake made by Patissier from New York is at the same height, and the thickness of the crepe is correct, as well as the amount of fresh cream. On the afternoon of the afternoon, you can add a sweet cake to a glass of beer like a New Yorker on the 3rd floor terrace where you can feel the atmosphere of the city.

More than 20 layers of crepe cake
Colorful seven-colored rainbow cake, Frank

Cafe Frank, who is hiding in the alley of Gyeongnidan, feels relaxed even if he is always crowded with people. This is thanks to the green pots surrounding the cafe, dry flowers hanging from the indoor ceiling, and colorful desserts on the shelves. The rainbow cake of the seven colors of Pajuno Chopa is also famous, but the blue and white tart is also popular.

Cafe Frank, an atmosphere in a quiet alley
The rainbow roll cake comes out at 12:00 pm, and is sold out within 10 minutes on weekends and within an hour on weekdays. The seven colors are so vivid that it feels like a bad food, but thanks to the attractiveness of edible pigments that cannot be obtained with natural colors, it has captured the taste of young people.
Cheongpodo tart with green grapes and pie
Even if they are pushed to the side of the cake, bakeries such as brioche full of savory butter flavor, freshly baked chiabata, and croissant with warm texture are steadily loved.
The fresh cream in the colorful color sheet does not feel better than I thought
Sweet Turkish Dessert, Kervan

When you enter the Kervan Bakery, your mouth will open in front of the showcase with dozens of desserts. A variety of exotic tastes abound to suit the taste of young people who have traveled to Turkey or love foreign snacks. As a bakery, there are not only sweet desserts, but there are many types of pale Turkish bread, such as Atsuma, Pohacha, and Seamite, which can be eaten as a meal or snack.

Kervan Bakery Showcase
The Turkish jelly, Turkish Delight, has a fragrant and savory taste, such as rose, orange, and mint. It is a dessert that appeared in the movie Chronicles of Narnia.
In Baclava, bitter black tea or coffee is perfect.
Baklava, a typical dessert in Turkey, is a homemade leek made with 40 layers of pie sheet with walnuts and pistachios and sweetened with sugar. You can also enjoy the rich sweetness when you eat it with bitter Turkish black tea.
Turkish bread eaten by Turkish people
Crispy and sweet taste that makes you stand in line, street churros

If you find a long line on the road leading to Gyeongnidan-gil after exiting Itaewon, it must be a procession of people who want to buy Churus. Even on weekdays, the line is long, but the wait time is not so long because it is fried quickly.

On the road to Gyeongnidan-gil, a long line to buy a churros
The churros, which is made by squeezing the dough for a long time, is crisp and has an excellent taste. If you don't like the sweetness of cinnamon sugar that's buried right after frying, you can also eat it lightly. Regulars prefer to eat without sugar.
Horseshoe-shaped churus
The achu menu that adds churros to ice cream is attractive because you can eat hot churros with cold ice cream. Sweet frozen mocha is also a recommended drink that goes perfectly with the churros.
Collect 2 churros to form a heart
Travel information

Tartin
-Address: 4, Itaewon-ro 23-gil, Yongsan-gu, Seoul
-Inquiries: 02-3785-3400


White veil
-Address: 178 Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul


Frank
-Address: 41 Sowol-ro 44-gil, Yongsan-gu, Seoul
-Inquiries: 070-8156-5459


Kervan
-Address: 204 Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul
-Inquiries: 02-790-5585


Street churros
-Address: 222 Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu, Seoul
-Inquiries: 02-792-1489


Nearby destinations
-Namsan Seoul Tower: 105, Namsan Park-gil, Yongsan-gu / 02-3455-9277
http://www.nseoultower.co.kr/

-War Memorial: 29 Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu / 02-709-3139
https://www.warmemo.or.kr/new/main/main.jsp

-Namsan Park: 231 Samil-daero, Jung-gu / 02-3783-5900
http://parks.seoul.go.kr/template/default.jsp?park_id=namsan


Rooms
-Hamilton Hotel: 179, Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu / 02-794-0171
http://www.hamilton.co.kr/

-IP Boutique Hotel: 221, Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu / 02-3702-8000
http://www.ipboutiquehotel.com/

-Crown Hotel: 138 Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu / 02-797-4111
http://www.hotelcrown.com/



※ The above information was updated in March 2017, and may be changed later, so please check before you travel.

item.title: Itaewon Freedom! - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Itaewon Freedom!

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

There is no 'impossibility' in this place, where different races and cultures mediated by their food and fashion are continuously mixed to produce another culture. In Seoul, South Korea, I headed to Itaewon to see the infinite freedom and taste of the world.
In college and vacation, there were motives for backpacking. They seemed to be 'freedom' themselves, leaving for adolescents who had to spend a vacation as a part-time job to save money for the next semester. It was also around that time that I dreamed of a wild dream of 'I'll see all the earth, water, and sky of the earth' through the wheels of reality. At the time, all I could do was lay out a map of the world and make a travel route, but even then, after looking around the globe a little, I felt like I wanted to leave anywhere.
Then one day, I realized the existence of 'he'. Itaewon, an island embraced by Seoul, Korea. It is said that there are more foreigners than Koreans, so you can enjoy food and culture from around the world as well as shopping, so you can enjoy the feeling of traveling abroad. Where else is this sweet temptation for a thirsty traveler? Eighty percent of the reason for leaving was to escape from reality and become a stranger. You can solve it with a single subway ticket. All you need is comfortable shoes and a map! Let's travel around the world in Itaewon, where you can reach right away whenever you want!
As you climb up the hill, a new world unfolds
Infinite freedom, the first attraction of Itaewon travel
Itaewon's Won originated from the fact that it was one of the four major stations for Hanyang travelers in early Chosun. It was a space from the beginning. In addition, during the Japanese colonial rule, the Japanese military headquarters entered, and after the Korean War, the US military base entered Yongsan and used 'Tarley Lee' and 'I-Ball Tae' to solve 'other children's neighborhoods'. did. The raw snags created by people being mingled and mingled are born as 'free space' that embraces 'time' and recognizes all kinds of 'diversity'.
Antique furniture street scene
There are buses heading to Itaewon, but here, we will introduce them to subways that are easier to find. You can get off at Itaewon Station on Subway Line 6, or at Hangangjin Station or Noksapyeong Station. If you are going for the first route, it is better to depart from Exit 3 of Noksapyeong Station, which connects to Itaewon-daero. Itaewon-daero is the real name of the main road that stretched out to the center of Itaewon. Let's call it 'Itaewon main street' here. Arched sculptures welcome Itaewon.
Antique furniture street scene
When you climb on the road, people of various skin colors appear in earnest. I'm looking at them walking comfortably in my salvation, so this is like a stranger. Where is this? Whose land is now walking on? But for a moment, as the nerves that became sensitive to various skin colors become more and more familiar, the song of UV that excited us some summer comes to mind. Itaewon Freedom, which is called in a space that allows infinite freedom that no one can interfere with!
Ewha Market Street, also called 'African Street'
Let's take a look at the map before the start of the trip to fully enjoy the freedom of chewy and sticky Itaewon. 'Itaewon Main Street' Centered largely 'Fashion · Islam · World Food · Antique Furniture · Africa (Ewha Market) Street' Things to see are split by the back. On the attached map of Itaewon, each street is labeled with a name. The street names may be slightly different, but it is unlikely that there will be a large crowd in conveying meaning by revealing the character in the name itself. Each street has its own characteristics, so you can choose according to your preference. It can be used for shopping and dining, and you can see even the 'Islamic culture', which is hard to find in the East.
Maps provided and Naver
Shopping and taste, the basics of Itaewon travel
When you come out of Exit 3 of Noksapyeong Station on Subway Line 6, you can see <Sujis>, who had a brunch in Itaewon. This is the 2nd floor of the <Hans Suit> building on the map. Itaewon Main Street, which extends coolly to the center of Itaewon, is at the back of <Itaewon Traditional Market> at the beginning of 'Itaewon Traditional Market', and horizontally the 'Fashion Street' spreads. Fashion and miscellaneous goods stores, including <Itaewon Underground Shopping Mall>, introduced as a treasure trove of fashion experts. Of course, there are road shops on the main street of Itaewon.
When you reach Itaewon Station along the main street, you can look around <Hamilton Hotel>. Behind <Hamilton Hotel> is 'World Food Street' where you can enjoy a round-the-world tour with 'flavor' 365 days a year. When you come out of Exit 1 of Itaewon Station and leave <KFC> to the right, go into the alley, and you can taste Indian cuisine from the front, starting with <Mugle>, where you can taste international cuisine.
Zelin on the World Food Street
Various restaurants are scattered all over Itaewon, but the first place to visit is the 'Itaewon gastronomy'. From <Santorini> where you can taste Greek food to <Selenium> where you can taste Bulgarian food.
Ask the staff slowly and choose what to taste
There are many pubs where you can enjoy food, simple yogi and beer. <Glam>, famous for its excellent water quality and atmosphere, is also located here. Earlier this year, Yongsan-gu announced an ambitious plan to revitalize this place as a 'special street for world food' and make it a tourist attraction.
Shirene shop ski baked with eggs on top of vegetables
The straight road facing <Hamilton Hotel> behind is 'Antique Furniture Street', where antique furniture stores are located. There is also a middle-sized relief store, so shopping enthusiasts continue to walk. You can get out of Exit 4 or 3 of Itaewon Station on Subway Line 6. From Exit 3, head towards the direction of Antique Furniture Street and turn left until you reach Ewha Market Street. It is also referred to as the 'African Street' because there are many African restaurants and hair shops.
Famous yogurt and cheese from Bulgaria
The place where the pole and various cultures of the pole coexist, here is Itaewon
Here, the crossroads you meet while going straight on are the starting points to embrace Itaewon's black past. If you keep going straight, you will come across the alley where the entertainment district against US troops was gathered when the US base was located in Yongsan. It is remembered under the name 'Hookers Hill'.
Islamic Central Masjid Road Scene
Turn right at the crossroads and the hilly path begins. Halal for Muslims (a product that Muslims are allowed to eat and use in the Islamic law) A restaurant and a transgender and gay bar are mixed casually.
Islamic Central Masjid Road Scene
'Islam Street', a path leading to the Islamic Central Masjid (Korea Islamic Central Assembly), curiously overlaps with entertainment establishments concentrated in 'Hookers Hill' and 'Gay Hill'. The symbol of conservativeness, represented by Hijab (Burca, Nicap, and Chador), which covers the face and body of women, is a border between the 'freedom' allowed by 'Itaewon', which is a place where entertainment centers that encompass Islamic culture and sexual minorities are well established. Paradoxes infinity.
Islamic Central Masjid
If you want to go right away, take exit 3 of Itaewon Station and turn right at the Itaewon Fire Station on the left. It will also be a good experience to stop by Tandoori and Curry shops filled with 'Islam Street' to taste their culture.
A little child I met at the Islamic Central Masjid
Turn left with Bogwang Elementary School in front of you and go straight ahead to reach the Islamic Central Support Center (Korea Muslim Central Association). Founded in 1976, Korea's first Islamic support is an indispensable space for traveling to Itaewon. White buildings, unique models and Arabic are eye-catching. There is a men's chapel on the second floor, a women's chapel on the third floor, and the Islamic school 'Prince Sultan' and a halal restaurant.
Indian fried rice, Bryani
Korean Muslim Central Conference ( http://www.koreaislam.org , 02-793-6908). This tour of Itaewon concludes by looking back to Islamic support. If you have lunch at <Hamilton Hotel>, try the Muslim taste at 'Islam Street' for dinner. Adding jjai and lasi to tandoori and curry, which we often know as Indian food, completes a hearty Muslim meal. Again, if you get only one ticket, the way back to reality opens.
Dip curry in rice or egg and eat
Travel information

1.Nearby Restaurants

You can enjoy international cuisine from all over Itaewon. Therefore, the trip to Itaewon, except for 'Tourism Tour', is 2% short. You can soothe your thirst for travel by tasting food from a country that suits your taste or wants to go.
Sujis 02-797-3698 / American Brunch
Lacigal Montmartre 02-796-1244 / French, Mussel cuisine
Muggle 02-796-5501 / Indian & Pakistani Royal Cuisine
Zelen 02-749-0600 / Bulgarian Cuisine
Santorini 02-790-3474 / Greek Cuisine
Forrestrest 02-794-9292 / Indian and Arabic Curry & Kebab
Salam Bakery 02-749-4323 / Turkish Confectionery

2.Accommodation

Hamilton Hotel Itaewon-dong, Yongsan-gu / 02-3786-6000
Grand Hyatt Yongsan-gu Hannam-dong / 02-797-1234
I Skin Boutique Hotel Hannam-dong, Yongsan-gu / 02-3702-8000

※ The above information was created in February 2013, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.

item.title: It seems like Seoul, like a foreigner, as if it is the present, as if it is the past - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Seoul scenery from the roof of Umdan-gil 'Um Record'

It seems like Seoul, like a foreigner, as if it is the present, as if it is the past

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

From the bustling street of Itaewon, you can take a brief walk through the Itaewon 119 Safety Center to the hidden spot in Itaewon, the way to Usadan-gil. The road is divided in front of Bogwang Elementary School, but as you go up the 10th road to the left Usadan-ro, the full-scale Usadan-gil tour begins. The entrance to Usadan-gil has an exotic atmosphere, with restaurants in Pakistan, Turkey, Egypt, Lebanon, and India, signboards written in Arabic, and strangers wearing hijab and turban. The Islamic Mosque of the Republic of Korea, the first Islamic member in Korea that opened in 1976, peaks in exotic mood.
The Islamic Bridge in Seoul is the landmark of Usadan-gil.
Since there is support for Islam, there are many halal food stores around. Halal food refers to food permitted to Muslims. Because it goes through strict standards according to Islamic law, it is an atmosphere that has recently been recognized as a health food, leaving religious colors. You don't have to be familiar with halal food. There is also a restaurant specializing in Halal certification on Usadan-gil. 'Eid' and 'Macan' are typical. We serve foods familiar to us, such as grilled fish, bulgogi, and bibimbap. It is the same as regular Korean food, except that it uses halal-certified ingredients. Many Muslims who want to taste Korean food come to Korea during their travels.
Unfamiliar but unfamiliar Pakistani food
If you want to taste exotic halal food, there are many choices. You can also enjoy kebabs, Indian foods, which are quite popular in Korea, and Pakistani, Egyptian, and Turkish foods that are still a bit unfamiliar. 'Pak India Restaurant' is a Pakistani food specialty store. Although the word Pakistani food is unfamiliar, the main menu is similar to Indian foods such as Tandoori Chicken, Curry, and Nan, and it is surprisingly familiar.
“Cerban Café” selling Turkish desserts
'Cerban Café' is also recommended. When you enter the store, first of all, the interior reminiscent of Turkey catches the eye. Decorated with ornaments and tiles from Turkey. Here, you can enjoy sweet Turkish desserts, tea and panini kebab. If you don't know what to eat, order from Baklava. Baklava is a sweet pastry with nuts, and is the representative dessert of Turkey. There are various types of original, pistachio and chocolate, and it goes well with Turkish coffee or tea. Other Turkish desserts, bread, cookies and ice cream are also available.
Usadan-gil, the old and new
Another attraction of Usadan-gil is that it retains the nostalgic Korean emotion and atmosphere. This area is a residential area where old houses and alleys are closely connected, and was designated as a redevelopment area in 2003. Since rent is relatively cheap compared to the surrounding area, young artists and young entrepreneurs entered the Usadan-gil since the early 2010s, creating a space full of personality. That's how Usadan Road is now.
The first member of 'Usadan-gil', 'Champ Coffee', has a nice appearance.
Many shops and workshops entered and disappeared repeatedly, and they also suffered from upset. Still, there are shops that keep this place. Champ Coffee and Otto are typical. 'Champ Coffee', an early member of Usadan-gil, has a nice appearance. It looks like an old rice house or a hole shop. This is a space where people in the neighborhood seemed to have stopped by. Champ Coffee actually acts as a love room for Usadan-gil. The largest table is a place where the owner works, and a seat where anyone can sit. When you sit here, you are a regular or wanderer. Various stories come and go in front of a cup of coffee. I don't know how to pass the time thanks to a good host, such as the background of the birth of a champa coffee, the way to drink the champa coffee, and how to drink it.
“Oto” wasabi kimbap, a taste that both Koreans and foreigners love.
‘OTTO’ near Champ Coffee is a kimbap restaurant introduced in TV programs 〈Master of Life〉 and American daily 〈New York Times〉. Wasabi kimbap, which contains romaine and wasabi sauce, is famous for its shape and taste. It is a taste that will be enjoyed not only by Koreans but also by foreigners, so visitors from various countries visit it. The outdoor terrace is as attractive as Gimbab. On a sunny day, sit on a small terrace overlooking Usadan-gil and try eating gimbap. It gives the taste and taste that will remain with life gimbap.
'Um Record' indoors with vintage and analog atmosphere
The highlight of Usadan-gil is hidden in 'Um Record' on the side of Dokkaebi Market. A sound record that easily and conveniently touches the vinyl (LP) culture, you can enjoy music with LP and cassette tape while drinking a drink or beer. Of course, you can also purchase. Famous artists come to shoot pictorial because of the vintage and analog atmosphere. In particular, the rooftop is a masterpiece. From the Namsan Seoul Tower to the Usadan-gil Dokkaebi Market, you can see the plastic tent at a glance. In between, old houses and alleys fill each other. Seoul, which embraces Usadan-gil, is far and warm. It is a moment to fully appreciate the essence of Usadan-gil, which sits on a high place.
Itaewon Antique Furniture Street Scenery
If you want to explore more of Itaewon's characteristic paths, go to Itaewon Antique Furniture Street. It originated from the purchase and sale of furniture sold by the U.S. military as it returned to its home country, and has now established itself as a representative street for selling antique furniture in Korea. Looking at classic and antique furniture and accessories, it feels like you are walking on a street in Europe.
‘Vinyl & Plastic’ is full of analog sounds such as LP, CD and cassette tape.
Itaewon's vintage charm continues in 'VINYL & PLASTIC'. This place operated by Hyundai Card is a space full of analog sounds such as LP, CD, and cassette tape. The first floor mainly exhibits and sells LP, and the second floor exhibits and sells CDs, and turntables, cassette players, and CD players are available everywhere to enjoy music. It is a place where analog music evokes nostalgia to familiar generations and fresh stimulation to new generations familiar with digital sound sources.
Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art, designed by architecture master Mario Bota, Jean Nouvel, and Rem Colehas
An art space like a treasure is hidden in the alley opposite vinyl and plastic. This is Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art. When you arrive here, the first thing to notice is the combination of three different buildings. It's amazing that the buildings designed by architecture masters Mario Bota, Jean Nouvel, and Lem Colhas are all in one place. The collections are also huge. It exhibits ancient and modern art, including national treasures and treasures, and works by famous authors from home and abroad.
Dimuseum in Seokdangno-ro
If you want to satisfy your artistic needs, the Reading Dangro is the perfect place. The Reading Dangro has recently emerged as a hot place due to its many galleries, complex cultural spaces, cafes, and restaurants, as well as a de-museum featuring a variety of artistic contents. You can also enjoy an art and culture tour by walking along the hill road leading from Hannam-dong to Oksu-dong and Seokdangdan-ro.
<Day trip course>
Samsung Museum of Art Leeum → Binyl and Plastic → Usadan-gil → Dokseodang-ro

<2 days and 1 night trip course>
Day 1 / Samsung Museum of Art Leeum → Vinyl & Plastic → Usadan-gil → Dokseodang-ro
Day 2 / Itaewon Antique Furniture Street → National Hangeul Museum → National Museum of Korea

○ Things to see

item.title: Yongsan War Memorial, seeing Korea's last divided country - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Scene of the reconstruction of Seoul's restoration of the armed forces displayed in the '6/25 War Room'

Yongsan War Memorial, seeing Korea's last divided country

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

On June 25, 1950, the dawn where everyone fell asleep before dawn. Gunshots echoed on the peaceful Korean Peninsula. The Korean War began when the North Korean army crossed the 38th parallel, which was the inter-Korean military demarcation line. The blood-sharing war between the Korean people continued with the casualties of the United States, the Soviet Union, and China until the July 1953 armistice. Even before enjoying the joy of escaping from the Japanese colonial rule. Introducing Yongsan's War Memorial, which records the history of the land half a century ago.

Remembrance Day and June, which embraced June 25, are the month of the Veterans' Day. Perhaps it is because of our ancestors who fought everything to protect the country that we can suffer from personal concerns such as dating, employment, and marriage. Before and after June 25th, how about remembering your ancestors for a few days and having a thankful heart? With that in mind, I visited the Yongsan War Memorial.

The history of the war recorded vividly at a glance
Before entering the war memorial, the giant pagoda at the front door and the statue of the patriotic army greet visitors.
Seoul Yongsan War Memorial
It was a picture of the time of the war, with vivid expressions and gestures from armed soldiers at the front to the youngest child at the back.
Seoul Yongsan War Memorial
On the left is the “Brother's Prize,” which symbolizes a divided country divided into South and North. Why did brothers with the same mother be divided into South Korean and North Korean forces and aimed at each other? I am sorry for the appearance of my younger brother who is digging into my brother's arms. After passing through the large square, we enter the interior of the war memorial.
The statue of the patriotic army
Let's start our full-scale war memorial tour. In order to properly examine the War Memorial, which consists of a total of three floors, a brochure is essential. When visiting the War History Room on the 1st floor and the 6/25 War Room on the 2nd floor, it is also very helpful to listen to the cultural narrator accompanying you four times a day.
2nd floor starting point for visiting the War Memorial
On the 2nd floor, where the entrance to the War Memorial Hall is displayed, the 'Hospital Memorial Room' honors and commemorates the ancestors who devoted their lives for their homeland, and '6 · 25', which displays all the processes of the Korean War from the North Korean invasion to the Armistice Agreement in an easy-to-understand manner. There is a War Room I and II. After that, you can look back on the 3rd floor, ‘The UN Room’, ‘The Donation Room’, the ‘Overseas Deployment Room’, and the ‘Army Development Room’. The history of war on the Korean Peninsula can be seen at a glance in the “war history” on the first floor.
Adding a description of the cultural commentator gives you a chance to see
A bloody ideological battle between the same peoples, the Korean War
On August 15, 1945, World War II war criminal Japan surrendered. This ended the war and the Korean Empire was able to escape the 36-year Japanese occupation period.
The site of the excavation of the remains of the Korean War was recreated.
The joy of regaining the country for a while, despite the independence movement in the meantime, the independence by Japanese ruin pushes the Korean Peninsula into another crisis. Despite the desire for 'self-independence and sovereignty', the Korean Peninsula is divided into south and north, where the waist is cut around the 38th parallel.
Weapons used during the war
In 1948, President Syngman Rhee was elected the first President of the Republic of Korea. As an independence activist, he was a thorough anti-communist and campaigned for reunification. In North Korea, there was Kim Il-sung, who had the Soviet Union on his back.
Our air force picked up the bomb and dropped it through the window.
In this way, even before the Korean peninsula enjoyed the joy of independence, the South had a democratic and communist (divided into) Han, but had a separate national system with two ideologies.
Detonating the Han River Railway Bridge to prevent North Korean troops
One day when the big and small fights between South and North continued around the 38th parallel, the dawn of June 25, 1950, North Korea went on a surprise attack before dawn. After that, the support of the Soviet Union was promised. South Korea, which lacks proper military training and equipment, is faced with helplessness. I broke the Hangang bridge and earned time, but it was pushed to the Nakdong River defense line. However, General MacArthur's Incheon Landing Operation (September 15, 1950) returned to Seoul in three months and recaptured Pyongyang and quickly advanced to the Yalu River.
President Syngman Rhee commanded North Korea with a desire for reunification
After the unification, the ROK military forces are pushed back to the south with the intervention of the Chinese army. It is a 1 · 4 retreat. At this time, the place where the South Korean troops, UN forces and North Korean refugees escaped was the Hungnam Wharf of Hamheung. In the movie <International Market>, this is where the main character lost his father and younger sister. The bloody war on the Korean Peninsula continued until the armistice was reached in July 1953. Even now, we are in a truce.
4D realistic video room where you can experience the time when you went to the evacuation route
While listening to the explanation of the commentator, you will see the “6/25 War Room I · II Hall”. It reproduces the appearance of the war and adds realism. From the background of the North Korean military invasion to the war and the Armistice Agreement, the process is clearly displayed. In particular, the 'Incheon Landing Operation 4D Experience Hall (7 minutes of screening time, 15 people watching once)' and 4D Realistic Video Room (9 minutes of screening time, 40 people watching once) 'show severe weather through 4D video, vibration, and blizzard effects. It is popular because you can experience the difficult evacuation process yourself.
Battle scene of white horse highland
Even if you look at the center of the '6/25 War Room', the hour of commentary is over 1 hour. After inspecting the 3rd floor and the donation room where you can meet the United Nations veterans, you will be transferred to the ROK military development room and overseas deployment room. It is no longer unfamiliar to say ‘Hochon’ I bow my head to the efforts of the ancestors who fought to protect the land. Learning about the history of this land is a bonus.
Turtle ship displayed outside the war history room on the 1st floor of the War Memorial
If you visited the War Memorial Hall with your children, it would be a good idea to go to the Children's Museum after visiting the 6/25 War Room. About a day in June, how about visiting the war memorial, thinking about the country?
A war history room displaying military relics of this land
TIP. War memorial
29 Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul War Memorial Hall / 02-709-3139 / 9:30 a.m. ~ 6 p.m. (Closed on Mondays, closed the day after the last holiday if Monday is a holiday included) / Free of charge for permanent exhibition / 3000 won until 2 hours for a small car 1,000 won per 30 minutes)
https://www.warmemo.or.kr/front/main.do
TIP. War Memorial Children's Museum

Daily admission is limited to the number of admissions per visit, and reservations are made for 60% of online reservations and 40% on the same day (first-come, first-served basis). 15 or more advance reservations required. 9:30 a.m. ~ 6 p.m. (Closed on Mondays, closed on the day following the last holiday if Monday is a holiday included) / Free admission / 02-709-3200

https://www.warmemo.or.kr/kids/main.do

Travel info

1. Nearby restaurants

Munbae Dongyuk knife: Yukkal (Yukgaejang + Kalguksu) / Baekbeom-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-713-6204

Center: Hand-made kalguksu with clams / Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-2235-0707
Waffle House: Strawberry Bingsu, Waffle / Cheongpa-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-711-2649
Kachinae style: 쫄 myeon sundubu, kimchi fried rice / Cheongpa-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-715-0806


2. Accommodation

Gayara Tree Hotel: Hangang-daero, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-798-5101
Crown Tourist Hotel: Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-797-4111

www.hotelcrown.co.kr

item.title: Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea - Is this liberation village? Casablanca, Storage Book & Film, Sofiti
item.description:
Enjoy a hearty meal at Casablanca

Is this liberation village? Casablanca, Storage Book & Film, Sofiti

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

Liberation Village, an exotic building with old buildings and old signs. If you walk a little further on this unfamiliar and familiar street, you will be waiting for Seoul in the 1960s, with a building on a steep hill. In the spring when the rain falls, I left for the pleasure of the Liberation Village.
Liberation Village, the name of the overseas Koreans who returned to their homeland in 1945 and the displaced people. No matter how you listen, this strange neighborhood is emerging as a hot street. Introducing the hot place of Haebangchon, where you can enjoy the charms different from Itaewon and Gyeongridangil, already filled with the smell of 2000s.
Is this liberation village? Morocco? Casablanca
In small spaces, people are gathering together. It's mostly foreigners too. Even the orderer is a charming foreigner with bushy beards, so it's easy to wonder if it's overseas. If you look back and outside, this is a liberation village.
Casablanca can always see foreigners loyal
Casablanca, run by two brothers from Morocco, has a taste of Moroccan that is so good that Daniel Tudor, author of 'A Country Who Lost Miracles, Lost Joy', said, 'It's much better than Itaewon's expensive food.' . Most of the ingredients and condiments used for the large and thick sandwiches for the price are real exhaust through their hands. We hope that foreigners can taste their hometown at an affordable price.
Figure of foreigner couple waiting for ordered menu
The simple yet generous ingredients in the savory, hot baguette are a good example of Morocco's intense and addictive exotic flavor. Shrimp sandwiches with Moroccan sauce and Harry's Hot Sauce are the most popular dishes! The Moroccan Chicken Sandwich, with its curry-flavored chicken and vegetables, is also available.
A simple yet rich sandwich from Casablanca's main menu
In addition, soup made from lentil beans, which are said to be good for health, and `` Makuda '', a potato croquette that is also enjoyed as a street food in Morocco, is also an unusual menu.
Lentil Soup Known as Health Food by Lee Hyo Ri
If you want a limited edition book, 'Storage Book & Film'
If exotic restaurants tempt you at the beginning of the liberation village, the world of those who are quietly living their lives without signboards over the steep hillsides raises questions. Among them, 'Storage Book & Film', which is located near the three-way intersection of emerging churches, is an independent bookstore that started with the sale of film cameras and has now expanded to the distribution of independent publications.
The shop is simple but there are a lot of treasures to see.
In addition to independent publications, the camera is based on various kinds of photo books. Independent magazine 'Walkjin' is a collection of photographs published by bookstore owners. Season 1, the last greeting with 22 episodes, consisted of 45-60 photographs of a city captured by one person. Is filling. If you want to participate, you can knock on the bookstore door.
A look at Storage Book & Film on a slope
In addition, there are various lectures related to publishing such as InDesign, book binding, and calligraphy. In particular, the four-week photo book making and independent publishing courses are solid enough to be consistently found by people.
Visitors who touch books for a long time and find their own books
Soapy genie where soap becomes work
In the past, there are various types of studios that look like hidden paintings between the alleys. Two years ago, when you open the door of the soap studio Sopizini, you will be greeted by the fragrances that make your sense of smell happy and the colors of the eyes strong.
Cutely decorated studio is cozy
The master's job is an English teacher. Soap making, a long-time hobby, became another happiness that can't be removed from life after five years since it started selling in flea markets. Not only the fragrance and color, but also the potency of each soap, her efforts go all the way to shine even more.
Emotional handmade soaps that can only be found in Sopigini
Like the British handmade cosmetics brand, Rush, we hope to become Korea's leading handmade soap brand beyond Haebangchon.
Showcase outside the studio
It is a warm spring day to hold hands with your loved ones. How about leaving your first outing with a liberation village where your senses as well as your eyes, nose and mouth are happy?
Sofignini owner making soap
Travel info

Casablanca
-Address: 33 Sinheung-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul
Inquiries: 02-797-8367

Storage Book & Film
-Address: 115-1, Sinheung-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul
Contact: 010-2935-9975

http://www.storagebookandfilm.com/shop/main/index.php

SOAPY GENIE

Contact: 010-7170-4336

-Mother's office: 5, Noksapyeong-daero 46-gil, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / Homemade burger, Brunch menu, Salad / 070-4158-1669

http://blog.naver.com/motheroffice

-Vitesca: 49, Hoemok-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / Steak / + 82-2-792-7746

http://www.bistecca.co.kr/

http://www.hamilton.co.kr/

item.title: Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour
item.description:
Hannam-dong Back Alley Travel Map

Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

'Usadan-ro 10-gil', once located in Itaewon, once called the Liberation Village, has once again attracted the attention of the world. On the last Saturday of every month, we will visit the 10th Usadan-ro, Hannam-dong, a “warm town” in Seoul, which is being transformed into a forward base for small-business start-up as well as a space for artistic creation for young people.

Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro 10-gil, a young base for convergence and convergence of youth
Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro is less than 900 meters from Bogwang Elementary School to Cheongseok Super. Exit No. 3 of Itaewon Station (Line 6) and go up 100 meters to the '119 Safety Center' alley. Looking up from here, you can see two towers towering towards the sky. 'Seoul Central Masjid'. In front of the main entrance to the Islamic Masjid, the road that stretches in the direction of the Han River is Usadan.
Daytime in the Islamic Central Member of Seoul
If there were a lot of pear trees and it was called 'Itaewon (梨 泰 院)', 'Usadan-ro' came from the record that the altar 'Usadan' was built here for the rain festival during Taejong, Joseon Dynasty. Usadan-ro 10-gil is a favorite place for photographers because of the interruption of the redevelopment project. Let's take a look at what's going on.
Seoul Islamic Central Masquerade Night
It's hard to find an alley where Shingu is harmonious, like Usadan-ro 10-gil from Seoul.
Hanjin Barber Shop
From old-fashioned barbershops that use firewood as fuel, to radio stations, rice cakes, Pakistani and Turkish restaurants, the traditional market blends together, and the guest house, as well as a jewelry design shop using the latest technology.
50-year-old Barber Chair at Hanjin Barber Shop
Walking along this road, there are so many foreigners that I wonder if there are more foreigners than Koreans.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Not only the geographical features of Itaewon and Islam mosques, but also because of the old houses, the rent is cheap and the language and living environment are convenient.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Itaewon's famous staircase and “Come in store”
Here is a community that drives young desires and change. The young cultural artists 'Usadandan (雩 祀 壇 團)' combines interesting cultural contents and business with the young people traders. Since 2012, young people who live in the area and have business spaces such as workshops have been working together to create local culture and revitalize their business.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The most representative business is the free market called 'stair leader'. The staircase, which started on 63 steps next to a mosque last spring, has only 30 to 40 participants, but now it has become one of the representative flea markets in Seoul.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The stairs are open from 12 am to 6 am on the last Saturday of every month.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
It was originally held on 63 steps, less than 3 meters wide. Sellers can be assigned three stairs to sell.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
However, for the safety and convenience of many visitors to the stairs, the place is moved to 'Usadan-ro 10-gil'.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
The 'coming shops' with the catch phrase 'Come in because it's hot' on both sides of the street, and the temporary seller table installed in front of it, replace the stairs.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
One of the popular programs of 'Staircase-In Come' is 'Tongtong Tour', which explores local culture.
Plump Tour
You will wander through the alley for two hours and hear interesting stories about the history and culture of the area.
Tattoo drawing
The tour program, which starts at the central mosque and ends at the supermarket, is conducted by young local residents.
Seller's homemade basil pesto
As with any flea market, the most popular places are the gourmet foods, tattoo houses, and portrait shops, where you can draw a portrait in 10 seconds for 10 won.
Portrait that draws in 10 seconds for 10 won
Usadan-ro 10-gil, Itaewon, transforming into an artist studio and cultural spot
There are a growing number of shops on Usadan-gil, with unique attractions run by young Soho entrepreneurs and artists.
Suine's Snack Store Famous for Spicy Chicken Feet
In particular, the Potato House, which is run by youth traders, sells the popular concept of Potato and Beer.
A young merchant who is good at Sabah
In addition to trendy foods such as meals and snacks for lunch and dinner in the evenings, Sooky's Snack Shop, a spicy chicken restaurant popular with famous celebrities, is whether it's a snack bar or a bar. It's weird.
Sophisticated Yukgaejang
Chicken shops such as Song Elim Chicken, which are commonly found in the traditional world of 'Eating My World', offer chefs' menus that change every day.
Deep-fried brown chicken
There are a variety of cafes on Usadan-gil.
coffee
There are cafes in various forms, ranging from “today's opening” to “entropy” reminiscent of the laws of physics and “champs” reminiscent of boxing films.
Entropy
Champ is a roasting café operated by three brothers and made freshly roasted coffee beans to become a favorite coffee shop not only for the elderly, but also for young people. Down. 10 minutes patiently wait.
Champ Coffee
'It would have opened today' is a free-spirited cafe that the owner wants to open, but now it is open every day except Sundays.
I would have opened today
There are designer jewelery shops on both sides of the street, opened by young people with both dexterity and sense.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Young designers and makers work together to produce and display jewelry, bags, and accessories, which are made by giving off artistic artists.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Typical shops include MK Leather Work (handmade leather bracelet), 'World I live' (handmade metal workshop), 'Mind Mine' (design jewelry), 'Luciente' (homemade jewelry), Ampersand (classic leather accessory), ' Thy '(leather wallet, wooden glasses, watch),' The 7th Heaven '(silverwork),' J & J Works' (jeans recycling accessory), and Xia's emotional doll.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
They create beautiful props that bring youth and run experience classes.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
In addition, 'WORKS', which commissions and sells works produced by independent designers, 'Soul Ink', which combines an art tattoo shop and a graffiti exhibition hall, 'Kiss Gallery' with three works and a bench for viewing outside the window, Don't forget 'Art Recipe'.
Kiss pics
HAUS, a guest house for travelers, not only accepts guests in three rooms with bunk beds, but also serves as a local tourist information center and love room.
Guest House Haus
Tiger House has a well-viewed guest house famous for its bare tacos and polar beer.
Tiger House
Usadan-ro 10-gil ending at Dokkaebi Market and Supermarket
Entering the 'Dokkaebi Market', the road is divided into two parts. On the right side is the 'Cheongseok Super', the end of 10 roads in Usadan-ro. Follow the road on your left to 'Supermarket'. 'Supermarket' is a three-story building that is used as a café, small gatherings, parties, and dining venues by renovating an existing building.
Supermarket cafe
'Dokkaebi market' is a traditional market. When the crackdown of the ward office comes, it avoids it like a goblin.
Han River catches a glance at rooftop table

The characteristic of the shops that entered Usadanro is the creative space that made the old buildings with minimal remodeling. So some shops use old signs to confuse visitors. Nevertheless, due to the affection and passion of young artists and entrepreneurs, Usadan Street, which can turn into an unsafe crime alley, is transformed into an art creative street, and the streets of young people representing Seoul following Hongdae, Garosu-gil, etc. It is transformed into.

Dokebi Market
P.S.

On the late evening of Wednesday, four days after the staircase-incoming ceremony was held, I went back to the street. It's nine o'clock, and people are cut off and most shops are closed. English phrases written on the glass window reflecting the appearance of a few young people busy preparing to open a design office called “P.S.” touch the chest. “People all have names. Sometimes, things name people. We name things that already have names. Now, this could be the only name. ” “A person has a name, and sometimes things name a person. Even when there is a name for things, people call it again. ” In addition, I remember the title of poet Lee Kyung-ok's collection of poetry `` Road makes a way by walking. '' I wonder if we should walk on Usadan Road and call out its name to create the Usadan Street that young people dream of. And wishes.

Travel info

Usadan-ro 10-gil
Location: Usadan-ro 10-gil, Yongsan-gu, Seoul-From Islamic Temple (39) to Hannam-dong Dokkebi Market
Stairway Information: March to October, Last Saturday of every month from 12:00 to 6:00 pm
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/wosadan


1. Nearby restaurants

The Baker's Table: 244-1, Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu / 070-7717-3501

Don Charley: 34, Hoemok-ro, Yongsan-gu / 070-8154-4475

El Grecos: 23, Noksapyeong-daero 54-gil, Yongsan-gu / 070-8263-8678


2. Accommodation

Hotel Crown Itaewon: 138, Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu / 02-797-4111

http://www.hotelcrown.com/

Hamilton Hotel: 179, Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu / 02-794-0171

http://www.hamilton.co.kr/

http://www.hotelcapital.co.kr/
